Package controller

Class ReversiController

  • java.lang.Object
    • controller.ReversiController
  • public class ReversiController
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    Ryan Garcia purpose: This is the controller for the Reversi game. It takes input from the view and returns information to it. It also modifies the ReversiModel class using the getters and setters in that class.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      ReversiController()
      This is a constructor used for actually running the program.
      ReversiController​(ReversiModel myModel)
      This is a constructor used only for testing.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      boolean canMove​(char playerChar)
      This checks if the current player has a valid move to make.
      void computerSkipped()
      This is a setter that the view can use if the computer has skipped its turn.
      int[] computerTurn()
      This is where the computer makes its move.
      char[][] getBoard()
      This is a method for the controller to hand a representation of the board to the view so that the view never has to interact directly with the model.
      int[] getScore()
      This checks each position on the board and adds up the score of each player.
      void humanSkipped()
      This is a setter the view can use if the human has skipped its turn.
      void humanTurn​(int row, int col)
      This takes user input from the view and uses it for the player to make a move.
      boolean isGameOver()
      If the human and the computer both don't have a move, the game is over.

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • ReversiController

        public ReversiController()
        This is a constructor used for actually running the program. It constructs it's own ReversiModel object when it is constructed so that the view never has to interact with the model.

      • ReversiController

        public ReversiController​(ReversiModel myModel)
        This is a constructor used only for testing. This is useful because it allows us to create a ReversiModel separately from the controller and set up the board in ways that otherwise might not be possible and hand that setup to the controller.
        Parameters:
        myModel - is a ReversiModel object.

    • Method Detail

      • isGameOver

        public boolean isGameOver()
        If the human and the computer both don't have a move, the game is over.
        Returns:
        is a boolean representing whether the game has ended.

      • getScore

        public int[] getScore()
        This checks each position on the board and adds up the score of each player.
        Returns:
        is an int[] representation of the scores of each player.

      • getBoard

        public char[][] getBoard()
        This is a method for the controller to hand a representation of the board to the view so that the view never has to interact directly with the model.
        Returns:
        is a char[][] representation of the board.

      • humanSkipped

        public void humanSkipped()
        This is a setter the view can use if the human has skipped its turn.

      • computerSkipped

        public void computerSkipped()
        This is a setter that the view can use if the computer has skipped its turn.

      • canMove

        public boolean canMove​(char playerChar)
        This checks if the current player has a valid move to make.
        Parameters:
        playerChar - is the char representing the pieces belonging to the current player.
        Returns:
        is a boolean representing whether a player has a valid move to make.

      • humanTurn

        public void humanTurn​(int row,
                      int col)
               throws ReversiCantPlaceException
        This takes user input from the view and uses it for the player to make a move. The player's input is fed in from the ReversiView and checked against the HashMap of valid moves. If the chosen move is not on the HashMap the player will be asked to choose again in the view.
        Parameters:
        row - is the int representation of the Y position the player has chosen.
        col - is the int representation of the X position the player has chosen.
        Throws:
        ReversiCantPlaceException - This exception is thrown when the human has chosen an invalid move.

      • computerTurn

        public int[] computerTurn()
        This is where the computer makes its move.
        Returns:
        is an int[] of length 2 that represents the move the computer has chosen.
